definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: for, I think, two hours each evening.
sentences.chinese: 我想是每晚排練兩個小時。

sentences.english: The evening finishes rehearsing, I have night snack with everyone.
sentences.chinese: 晚上排練完，我和大家去喫宵夜。

sentences.english: She will run over her lines in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 她將在晚上排練一次她的臺詞。

sentences.english: Meng Ni and also after the rehearsal, the constant waiting at the gate of the theatre Meng Ni again.
sentences.chinese: 孟妮與亦名排練完後，之恆又在劇院門口等着孟妮。

sentences.english: A smooth dress rehearsal augured well for the play.
sentences.chinese: 順利的服裝排練預示着演出成功。

sentences.english: We're just street performers. We were rehearsing.
sentences.chinese: 我們只是街頭賣藝的，我們正在排練。

sentences.english: In the past, there were no rehearsal halls and dance theatres specialized for dancers.
sentences.chinese: 過去，沒有專門的舞蹈排練廳和舞蹈劇場。

sentences.english: Rehearsals will be held at UC's College- Conservatory of Music.
sentences.chinese: 排練將在辛辛那提大學音樂學院裏舉行。

sentences.english: TTP teacher Shu Zhuang rehearse with her students for the last time before their big performance.
sentences.chinese: 實踐劇場的淑莊老師跟學生們做最後的排練。

sentences.english: We are planning on practicing fire drills next week.
sentences.chinese: 我們計劃在下週在校內進行消防演習排練。

sentences.english: We're in a rehearsal space in Shakespeare Theatre Company's 8th Street studios.
sentences.chinese: 我們所在的，是莎士比亞大劇場8號大街排練廳。

sentences.english: Rehearsals moved to their final phase at Staples Center.
sentences.chinese: 在斯臺普斯中心排練已進入最後階段。

sentences.english: Practice your final script at least five times; Record and re-listen to your rehearsals.
sentences.chinese: 練習你的劇本至少五次，記錄和重新聽你的排練。

sentences.english: The orchestra has rehearsed many times for the program.
sentences.chinese: 管絃樂隊已經爲這個節目排練了好多次。

sentences.english: We hadn’t rehearsed often enough so I forgot my lines.
sentences.chinese: 我們兩個排練得根本不夠，所以我忘了我的臺詞。

sentences.english: So I went back into the rehearsal studio.
sentences.chinese: 所以我又回到了排練廳。

definition: to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
script for play, opera, movie etc/screenplay/scenario
cast and crew/performers and production team
